parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Aggregate candidates.

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [speaker, side, unit, place, time] '''targetsAggregate''' candidates

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [speaker, side, unit, place, time]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> candidates: [[Array]] -  array of targets in the following format:
<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>[</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext>[accuracy, target, targetSide, targetType, targetPosition, targetAge],...] where:
* accuracy: [[Number]] - a coefficient, which reflects how close the returned result to the query filter. Range: 0 - 1 (1 - best match)
* target: [[Object]] - the actual target object
* targetSide: [[Side]] - side of the target
* targetType: [[String]] - target [[typeOf]]
* targetPosition: [[Array]] - [x,y] of the target 
* targetAge: [[Number]] - the actual target age in seconds (can be negative)

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>x1 </name>=<value> <ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner>_aggregation = [player, sideEnemy, "", [], 0] targetsAggregate (player targetsQuery [objNull, sideUnknown, "", [], 0])</inner><close></pre></close></ext>could return something like this: <br>
<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>[[["COUNT0",1],["SIDE0",WEST],["UNIT0","B_Soldier_F"],["PLACE0",[[<null>,<null>],0,<null>]],["TIME0",[-0.9,-0.9]],["UCOUNT0",1],["UTYPE0","...</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[targetsQuery]], [[forgetTarget]]
</value></part></template>
